item.title: System Components
item.description: At a minimum, the system includes the cart, camera, microscope, 3D glasses, keyboard, and touchpad. However, the following is an example of a typical setup, including additional devices: 1 System – Receives video from the camera and displays 3D images. 2 Patient Bed – Holds the patient at a comfortable level. 3 Microscope stand – Suspends a microscope above the patient. 4 Camera – Captures 3D video. 5 Microscope – Magnifies the view of the camera.

item.title: Software Overview
item.description: To navigate the system interface, use the touchpad and keyboard to select items or enter text. To start operating, select a doctor profile and patient profile.

item.title: Navigation
item.description: The following icons appear throughout the interface. Indicates the touchpad cursor location. Saves the pending changes and closes the dialog box. Switching to a different setting panel saves any pending changes. Closes the dialog box and does not save pending changes. Opens another dialog box to change additional settings. Saves settings to a connected USB drive.

item.title: Home Screen Layout
item.description: 1 Home panel – Contains menus to manage doctor profiles, add or delete patient profiles, and start a case. 2 Shutdown button – Turns off the system. 3 System Settings button – Opens the system settings options (see System Settings). 4 Media Management App button – Opens an application to view and edit recorded video and snapshots. 5 Eject Drive button – Safely ejects a connected hard drive.

item.title: Doctor Profile Management
item.description: Doctor profiles save customized user settings for optimal visualization. Manage the profiles on the system from the Home panel. 1 Doctor Defaults button – Saves current doctor settings as the default values or restores doctor settings to the saved default settings. 2 Doctor Export button – Exports the current doctor profile to a connected USB drive. This button is only available when an external USB drive is connected. 3 Add Doctor button – Creates a new doctor profile.

item.title: Add a Doctor Profile
item.description: To create a new doctor profile, perform the following: In the Home panel, select the doctor Add button. The New Doctor dialog box opens. In the Name field, enter a profile name. To copy settings from another profile, perform the following: Click the Copy Settings From toggle switch. Click Local to copy a profile stored on the system or click USB to copy a profile from a connected USB drive.

item.title: Delete Doctor Profile
item.description: In the Home panel, select a doctor profile. Click the doctor Delete button. Click Confirm.

item.title: Set Doctor Profile Settings
item.description: In the Home panel, select a doctor profile. Click Doctor Defaults. Perform one of the following: Click Save all to save the current settings as the profile default settings. Click Restore all to set the current settings to the saved profile default settings.

item.title: Export Doctor Profile
item.description: Connect a USB drive to a USB connector. In the Home panel, select a doctor profile. Click Export Doctor.

item.title: Patient Profile Management
item.description: Patient profiles store basic patient information. Manage patient profiles in the Home panel. 1 Add Patient button – Creates a new patient profile. 2 Delete Patient button – Deletes the selected patient profile. 3 Patient Selection drop-down menu – Sets settings and patient information according to the selected patient profile. Topics in this section include the following:

item.title: Add Patient Profile
item.description: In the Home panel, select the patient Add button. The Patient Information dialog box opens. Enter a first and last name. Select one of the following: OD – right eye OS – left eye To add a date of birth, patient ID name, or procedure, click Optional Data. a. In the Date of Birth field, enter a year, month, and day. b. In the ID field, enter a unique identification code.

item.title: Delete Patient Profile
item.description: In the Home panel, select a patient profile. Click the patient Delete button. Click Confirm.

item.title: Live Case
item.description: In the Home panel, click Start Case. Topics in this section include the following:

item.title: Case Layout
item.description: 1 Case timer – Displays the duration of the surgical case. 2 Record video button – Starts and stops recording video of the screen. A red dot appears next to the case when a case is being recorded. 3 Snapshot button – Takes a picture of the screen. 4 Information panel – Displays basic information to identify the current patient and case. 5 Quick Access Bar – Includes buttons to quickly change various display settings.

item.title: Recordings
item.description: Recordings save video from the camera. To save overlay information, enable the applicable DataFusion feature. Overlay information includes patient and case information from the system, or other data from connected systems.

item.title: Quick Access Bar
item.description: The Quick Access Bar contains specified buttons for display options. Click the buttons to quickly change settings or, if available, click the drop-down menu below buttons to select a specific option. NOTE: To change the available buttons or the options available for a button, see Settings. Use the Quick Access Bar to change the following display modes and settings: 1 Swap layout – Changes the number of video inputs displayed on the Case screen (1 or 2).

item.title: End Case
item.description: When the case is complete, click End Case. Recordings stop and the following prompts appear: If any imaging mode changes were made during the case, select Yes to save the changes or No to delete the changes. If desired, save recorded video. To save a copy of the video to an external hard drive, connect one to a side panel USB connector. If a patient profile was not selected, enter patient information.

item.title: Settings
item.description: To adjust image settings, click Settings. 1 Vit System button – Includes overlay options and imaging mode linking. 2 Phaco System button – Includes overlay options. 3 Screen Layout button – Adjusts the display layout and what features are included during surgical cases. 4 Recording button – Sets video parameters. 5 Color Channels button – Manages color emphasis. 6 Light Profiles button – Adjusts colors depending on the light source.

item.title: Screen Layout
item.description: To access the Screen Layout options, click Screen Layout. To set basic layout features, click Basic. To set advanced layout features, click Advanced. 1 Patient Info drop-down menu – Sets the frequency in which patient information displays during operation. 2 PiP Location – Sets the screen corner to display input from the secondary source during PiP layout. This option applies only when Secondary Viewport is set to PiP. 3 Secondary Viewport buttons – Sets the layout for a secondary viewport the Screen Layout button switches to when clicked.

item.title: Recording Settings
item.description: To access Recording options, click Recording. NOTE: Recording settings cannot be changed while recording video. Basic and Advanced To set basic settings, click Basic. To set advanced settings, click Advanced. 1 Movies Format buttons – Saves video files as .avi or .mov files. 2 Show Logo toggle switch – Displays the system logo in the bottom-left corner during operation if Record DataFusion is disabled. 3 Auto-Record toggle switch – Automatically starts recording when a case starts.

item.title: System Settings
item.description: System settings apply to all doctor profiles on the system and are primarily related to connecting devices to the system. They also include system information. To access System Setting options, click System Settings. Topics in this section include the following:

item.title: Language
item.description: The Language system settings control the language the system displays. Contact Technical Services for additional languages. To change the language, perform the following: In the Language drop-down menu, select a language. Click Confirm.

item.title: About
item.description: The About system settings displays general system information, including software version and a copy of the user guide.

item.title: Camera
item.description: The camera is a stereoscopic 3D camera with high dynamic range. Mount the camera on a surgical microscope. 1 Camera – Captures video from the connected microscope. 2 Strain relief screw – Holds the camera cable in place to reduce stress on the cable connection. 3 USB camera connector – Connects the camera to the cart. 4 Iris slider – Adjusts light exposure captured by the camera.

item.title: Cart
item.description: The cart receives video input from the camera and additional data from other connected devices, and then outputs the results on the monitor. 1 Primary Display – Produces 3840 x 2160p 3D resolution video. 3D images require passive, circularly-polarized 3D glasses. 2 Cable access – Routes cables from inside the system to external devices. 3 Front panel connectors – Includes 2 USB, an HDMI output, and a composite connector.

item.title: Displays
item.description: Depending on the display model, the system connects to the display either through DisplayPort input 1 or both the HDMI input 3 and COMM cable connector. The system also supports a secondary display to either duplicate the primary display view or show a subset of features.

item.title: Glasses
item.description: 3D images require passive, circularly-polarized 3D glasses. If necessary, wear the 3D glasses over prescription glasses. CAUTION The 3D glasses must be worn in front of the laser protective eyewear to avoid distorting the 3D effect.

item.title: Keyboard and Mouse
item.description: The system includes both a wired and a wireless keyboard with an integrated touchpad. The wireless keyboard is rechargeable and the battery indicator displays the charge level while the keyboard is on. 1 Power indicator – Lights according to the battery status Blinking green - The battery is charging. Solid green – The battery has adequate charge. Blinking red – The battery power is low. Recharge the battery. 2 USB connector – Connects the keyboard to a power source to recharge the batteries.

item.title: Footswitch (Optional)
item.description: The footswitch performs basic functions during operation through controls operated by a foot. 1 Left push button – Changes the camera orientation between standard and inverted. 2 Right push button – Starts or stops movie recordings. 3 Left pedal – Cycles to the previous imaging mode. 4 Right pedal – Cycles to the next imaging mode.

item.title: Accessories
item.description: The system may include the following accessories: Lens cap - Protects the camera lens. Cable straps - Secure the camera cable to the microscope. Cable hooks - Route loose cables or coil cable for storage or transportation. Display remote and batteries - Sets the display settings. Use only if directed by Technical Services. The remote may require AA or AAA batteries depending on the display modal. Screen protector - Protects the display when the system is in storage.

item.title: Input Source
item.description: The input source controls which port is displayed in the secondary view. To set the secondary input source, click Input Source. NOTE: No other sources are available for systems with a connected Analysis System.

item.title: Monitor
item.description: The monitor system settings have adjustable settings for displays connected to the system. To access Monitor options, click Monitor. 1 Monitor drop-down menu – Selects a display. 2 Primary Monitor toggle switch – Sets the selected display to the primary display. Only use the provided monitor as the primary monitor. 3 View drop-down menu – Sets the content on the screen. Select one of the following: Control - Displays the user interface and system camera image.
